translated: Birth Stories🔽The Fives🔽The Chapter about the Ascending Scale of Beauty
The Palāsa-tree Birth Story
“The swan speaks of the palāsa-tree,
the banyan-tree is born of the earth;
While sitting in your lap,
he cuts off my possessions.”
“Let the banyan-tree grow,
I will be the support of the tree;
Just as my father and mother,
so will he be to me.”
“What you are nurturing in your lap,
the milk-tree that is so fearful,
I will go away from you,
I do not like his growth.”
“Now he is calling me,
the great fire-demon;
Not knowing the swan,

original: mahā me bhayamāgataṁ”.🔽“Na tassa vuḍḍhi kusalappasatthā,🔽Yo vaḍḍhamāno ghasate patiṭṭhaṁ;
analyzed: mahā me bhayam āgata  na tassa vuḍḍhi kusala ppasatthā  yaḥ vaḍḍhamānaḥ ghasate patiṭṭha
translated: a great fear has come to me.”🔽“The growth of him who, while growing, devours his support,🔽is not praised by the wise;
The wise one, while going around to stop his destruction,
throws him down to be cut off at the root.”🔽The Palāsa-tree Birth Story is the tenth.
The Chapter about the Ascending Scale of Beauty is the second.
